subject: Psychology
title: Start Tiny
description: A short lesson to help you apply Start Tiny.

hook.text: BJ Fogg wanted to start flossing. He didn't floss all his teeth. He flossed one. Just one. It worked.

buildup.text: Fogg's Tiny Habits method says new habits should be so small they require almost zero motivation.

discovery.text: One pushup. One page. One minute of meditation. Tiny removes the barrier of effort and builds consistency.

twist.text: The goal isn't the tiny action itself. It's wiring the automatic behavior. Once wired, you naturally do more.

climax.text: People fail not because they aim too low but because they start too big. Tiny is the on-ramp to lasting change.

punchline.text: Make it so small you can't say no. Then let it grow.

quiz.question: Why does BJ Fogg recommend starting with tiny habits?
options: Tiny removes the effort barrier and builds consistency first
Small actions never lead to bigger ones
You should always start with the hardest version
